description.value: Used to ensure that informaticists and knowledge engineers have what they need from L1 content in order to successfully produce L3 content

text.value: Guideline Content (L1) - Complete L1 content and documentation for the guideline
Permalink - Permanent URL for the guideline content, if available
Citation - Appropriately formatted citation for the guideline
Status - Current status of the guideline, including last reviewed, endorsing parties, and timeline of pending changes
Contact - Contact information for the guideline developer and steward
Guideline Developer - Direct contact for guideline developer
Content/Guideline Steward Contact - Public contact information for the guideline steward
Legal >Licensing - All legal and licensing issues are addressed
Guideline licensing terms - What are the licensing terms for the use of the guideline?
Content licensing terms - What will the licensing terms for the L2 and L3 artifacts be?
Additional licensing terms - What additional content licensing is required, if any
Scope - Clearly determine the overall scope of the project
Goal(s) - What goal(s) is the recommendation trying to achieve?
Target Recommendations - What recommendations are targeted for the project
Per Recommendation - For each recommendation, ensure the following
GuideLine Implementability Appraisal (GLIA) checklist - A GLIA checklist is provided
Triggering - How will the recommendation be triggered?
Terminologies - What terminologies are involved?
Clinical State - What clinical states are involved?
Setting - What settings or environments are relevant?
Periodic - How often should the recommendation be triggered/reviewed?
Condition - How will the condition be expressed?
Terminologies - What terminologies are involved?
Clinical State - What clinical states are involved?
Action - How will the action be expressed?
Request/Order - What orderables are involved?
Assessment - What instruments are involved?
Questionnaire - What questionnaires are involved?
Monitoring - How will the recommendation be assessed/monitored?
Measures - What measures are available/appropriate?
Performance Measures - What measures are looking at the aspects related to the clinical condition?
Process Measures - What measures are looking at the aspects related to CDS workflow and feasibility
Outcome Measures - What measures are looking at the aspects related to the health of the patient
Guideline Evaluation Metrics - What measures are looking at how well the recommendation is meeting its goal(s)?
Use Case - A clear description of a use case for the recommendation
Diagram/ workflow diagram - A visual depiction of the workflow for the recommendation
Test Plan - A description of the testing plan
Existing Artifacts - What existing artifacts are available, either wholesale, or for derivation and reuse?
Terminologies - What value sets are available?
Existing - What value sets exist? Can they be reused or do they need modification/augmentation?
Need to be created - What value sets need to be created?
Assessments - What formal instruments are available? Can they be reused?
Questionnaires - What questionnaires are available?
Profiles - What profiles are available?
PlanDefinition/ActivityDefinition - What definitions are already available?
Libraries - What libraries are available?
Test Data - What test data is available? What test data generation facilities are available?
Decision Aids - What aids are available that help patients make decisions or can be used for shared decicion-making?
Publication Strategy - What publication strategy will be used for the L2/L3 content?
Target Repository - What publication channel will be used? (e.g. FHIR Registry, CDS Connect)
Project Repository - Set up a project repository and collaboration wiki
Publishing URL - Establish a base URL for the content
Terminology Publication Strategy - Where will the terminologies be published? (e.g. FHIR Registry, Simplifier, VSAC, PHINVADS)
Stewarding and Maintenance - How will the content be maintained over time?
Change Management - What external dependencies will impact the content? Document change sources and timelines
L2 Steward - Who will maintain the content long term?
Strategy - What is the strategy for reacting to changes?
Piloting - Who will pilot the content as part of the development process?
Pilot Site(s) - Identify at least one primary pilot site (alpha) and potentially second phase (beta) sites.
Pilot Team Members - Engage pilot site members as part of the development team
System Feedback
SDO Feedback - Are there gaps in the specifications being used that would trigger feedback to an appropriate SDO?
Policy - Are there problems in a policies that would trigger feedback to the policy owner?
Case Reporting - Is there a potential need for monitoring disease trends or outbreak management?
Existing Artifacts
